channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Stranded Pinay cruise ship worker kills self off Barbados
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: A Filipina crewmember of a cruise ship docked in Barbados took her own life while awaiting repatriation to the Philippines amid the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic, Foreign Affairs Secretary Teodoro Locsin Jr. said yesterday.

item.title: School registration hits 10 million
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: Almost 10 million learners have registered during the first eight days of this year’s school enrollment as the Department of Education starts to roll out multiple learning modalities amid the country’s fight against the coronavirus disease 2019 or COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: ‘Balik Probinsya’ suspended
item.author: Elizabeth Marcelo
item.description: The government’s “Balik Probinsya, Bagong Pag-Asa” program has been suspended to prioritize the return to the provinces of people stranded in Metro Manila, the program’s executive director Marcelino Escalada Jr. said yesterday.

item.title: Mañanita Independence rites by invitation only
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: As the threat of coronavirus disease 2019 infection persists, the main event to commemorate the 122nd Philippine Independence Day will be strictly by invitation only.

item.title: Anti-terror bill critics can go to court — Palace
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Groups opposed to the Anti-Terrorism Bill are free to question it before the courts even after its enactment into law, Malacañang said yesterday, as calls mount for President Duterte to veto the measure due to fears that it may lead to abuses.

item.title: BIR to online sellers: Register, pay taxes
item.author: Mary Grace Padin
item.description: With more Filipinos doing business online, the Bureau of Internal Revenue is now requiring online sellers and those making money through digital platforms to register with the tax agency and pay the necessary taxes.

item.title: China’s Xi calls Duterte
item.author: Edith Regalado
item.description: President Duterte received a call from Chinese President Xi Jinping last night, leading to a conversation lasting several minutes.

item.title: Dine-in to return June 15
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: The Inter-Agency Task Force on Emerging Infectious Diseases has allowed dine-in service in restaurants and fast-food establishments to resume in general community quarantine or GCQ areas starting June 15, the Department of Trade and Industry said.

item.title: No chance passengers allowed at airports
item.author: Rudy Santos
item.description: Domestic and international passengers without confirmed tickets for the day will not be allowed at the airport terminals to avoid congestion and getting stranded.

item.title: Ex-DICT exec Rio victimized by trolls
item.author: Rainier Allan Ronda
item.description: Former Department of Information and Communications Technology undersecretary Eliseo Rio Jr. is himself one of the victims of alleged fake Facebook accounts.
